      18b
      A short history of SHELX
      Sheldrick, George M.
      Acta Crystallographica, Section A: Foundations of Crystallography (2008), 64 (1), 112-122CODEN: ACACEQ; ISSN:0108-7673. (International Union of Crystallography)
      An account is given of the development of the SHELX system of computer programs from SHELX-76 to the present day. In addn. to identifying useful innovations that have come into general use through their implementation in SHELX, a crit. anal. is presented of the less-successful features, missed opportunities and desirable improvements for future releases of the software. An attempt is made to understand how a program originally designed for photog. intensity data, punched cards and computers over 10000 times slower than an av. modern personal computer has managed to survive for so long. SHELXL is the most widely used program for small-mol. refinement and SHELXS and SHELXD are often employed for structure soln. despite the availability of objectively superior programs. SHELXL also finds a niche for the refinement of macromols. against high-resoln. or twinned data; SHELXPRO acts as an interface for macromol. applications. SHELXC, SHELXD and SHELXE are proving useful for the exptl. phasing of macromols., esp. because they are fast and robust and so are often employed in pipelines for high-throughput phasing. This paper could serve as a general literature citation when one or more of the open-source SHELX programs (and the Bruker AXS version SHELXTL) are employed in the course of a crystal-structure detn.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhsVGhurzO&md5=8f91f10be4a9df74b2a9dad522c71e6e
    19. 19
      (a) Volkringer, C.; Loiseau, T. Cryst. Growth Des. 2008, 8, 685– 689
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      19a
      Hydrothermal Crystallization of Three Calcium-Based Hybrid Solids with 2,6-Naphthalene- or 4,4'-Biphenyl-Dicarboxylates
      Volkringer, Christophe; Marrot, Jerome; Ferey, Gerard; Loiseau, Thierry
      Crystal Growth & Design (2008), 8 (2), 685-689CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Three new hybrid solids 1, 2, and 3 of Ca dicarboxylates were obtained using hydrothermal conditions (24 h, 180°) with 2,6-naphathalenedicarboxylic acid (H2ndc) and 4,4'-biphenyldicarboxylic acid (H2bpdc) ligands. According to their single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses, the three compds. exhibit dense networks with distinct dimensionalities for both the inorg. subnetwork and the whole structure. Three-dimensional (3D) 1 (Ca2(OH)2[ndc]) is built from layers of Ca oxo-hydroxide, pillared via the ndc ligands. Ca is 7-fold coordinated with a monocapped trigonal prismatic surrounding (CaO4(OH)3). In 2 (Ca(H2O)[bpdc]), the structure consists of infinite chains of Ca polyhedra in a pentagonal bipyramidal coordination (CaO6(H2O) unit), the biphenyldicarboxylate species acting as scaffolds for the 3-dimensional structure. Complex 3 (Ca(H2O)3[bpdc]) also contains infinite chains of Ca polyhedra (with 8-fold coordination - CaO4(H2O)4 unit) but this time isolated because one of the two carboxylate functions of the ligand is terminal. The structure is therefore 1-dimensional. A network of H bonds ensures the stability of this structure. Crystal data for 1: monoclinic, P21/c, a 12.627(2), b 7.8053(13), c 5.8555(10) Å, β 95.954(3)°; for 2: monoclinic, P21, a 5.8237(4), b 6.9339(5), c 14.7231(11) Å, β 93.588(3)°; for 3: orthorhombic, Ima2, a 6.5444(3), b 30.2468(13), c 7.2194(3) Å.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhsVehur7O&md5=58bee7c947d477104b621cd925b7c259
      (b) Pachfule, P.; Das, R.; Poddar, P.; Banerjee, R. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 1215– 1222
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      19b
      Solvothermal Synthesis, Structure, and Properties of Metal Organic Framework Isomers Derived from a Partially Fluorinated Link
      Pachfule, Pradip; Das, Raja; Poddar, Pankaj; Banerjee, Rahul
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (4), 1215-1222CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Solvothermal reactions of Cu(NO3)2·3H2O with 4,4'-(hexafluoroisopropylidene) bis(benzoic acid) (C17H10F6O4, H2hfbba) and terminal monodentate ligand 3-methylpyridine (3-picoline/3-mepy) in the presence of N,N-DMF and N,N-di-Et formamide (DEF) solvents gave rise to two structurally different two-dimensional (2D) fluorinated metal org. frameworks (F-MOFs). The effect of the choice of solvent was clearly reflected in the structures obtained. The F-MOFs reported are [Cu2(hfbba)2(3-mepy)2]·(DMF)2(3-mepy) (F-MOF-4), [Cu2(hfbba)2(3-mepy)2] (Cu-F-MOF-4B), and [Zn2(hfbba)2(3-mepy)2]·(3-mepy) (Zn-F-MOF-4B) which displays interesting 2D structures with and without interdigitation depending on the solvent used. The structures of these F-MOFs were detd. by x-ray crystallog. and further identified by IR spectroscopy, powder x-ray diffraction (PXRD), and TGA. The effect of interdigitation was reflected in the gas adsorption and magnetic properties of these F-MOFs. These F-MOFs also show comparable H2 and CO2 uptake depending on their structural variation. Temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibility measurements over a wide range of temps. exhibit dominantly short-range antiferromagnetic behavior, with weak ferromagnetic behavior showing up at very low temps., which is evident from opening of the hysteresis loop with a finite value of coercivity in both F-MOF-4 and Cu-F-MOF-4B. The authors obsd. a smaller value of μeff per Cu atom and coercivity in Cu-F-MOF-4B than the F-MOF-4 due to relatively larger distances between the neighboring dicopper paddlewheel secondary building unit.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXisVWkurY%253D&md5=7cb681c2cd26b490b959640e1884e6cd
      (c) Srinivasu, K.; Ghosh, S. K. J. Phys. Chem. C. 2011, 115, 16984– 16991
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      19c
      Tuning the Metal Binding Energy and Hydrogen Storage in Alkali Metal Decorated MOF-5 Through Boron Doping: A Theoretical Investigation
      Srinivasu, K.; Ghosh, Swapan K.
      Journal of Physical Chemistry C (2011), 115 (34), 16984-16991CODEN: JPCCCK; ISSN:1932-7447. (American Chemical Society)
      Using ab initio quantum chem. calcns., the authors explore the possibility of improving the light metal binding energy as well as the hydrogen adsorption energy in MOF-5 so that the clustering problem at high concn. can be overcome. To mimic the linking group (C6H4(COO)22-) in MOF-5, the authors have considered the simple benzene ring. Because the binding energy of light metals (Li, Na, and Mg) to benzene is poor, the authors have modified the C ring by substituting 2 C atoms with 2 B atoms. The metal ion (atom) interaction with C4B2H62- (C4B2H6) is very strong, and the interaction energies are extremely high as compared with the metal cohesive energies. Metal sites in these complexes have partial ionic (pos.) character and adsorb mol. hydrogen with reasonably good adsorption enthalpies. The authors have also studied the extended periodic system of Li as well as Na-decorated modified MOF-5 and their hydrogenated counterparts. In the case of Li-decorated MOF-5, each formula unit is found to adsorb 18 hydrogen mols. with 3 H2 per Li atom at zero temp., which corresponds to a gravimetric d. of ∼4.3%. However, in the case of Na-decorated MOF-5, the corresponding wt % is 7.4 because each Na can adsorb 6 mol hydrogen with 36 hydrogen mols. per formula unit.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXpslajtrw%253D&md5=08395ddabe106fa90377f9ace7bdb765
      (d) Plonka, A. M.; Banerjee, D.; Banerjee, J. B. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 2460– 2467
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      19d
      Effect of Ligand Structural Isomerism in Formation of Calcium Coordination Networks
      Plonka, Anna M.; Banerjee, Debasis; Parise, John B.
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (5), 2460-2467CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Using different structural isomers (2,5-; 2,4-; 2;6-; 3,4-; 3,5-) of pyridinedicarboxylic acid (PDC), nine calcium-based coordination networks [Ca4(2,5-PDC)4(DMF)]n (1), [Ca(2,5-PDC)(H2O)]n (2), [Ca(2,5-PDC)(DMF)]n(3), [Ca(2,4-PDC)(H2O)]n (4), [Ca(2,4-PDC)(DMF)]n (5), [Ca(2,6-PDC)]n (6),[Ca2(3,4-PDC)2(H2O)]n (7), [Ca(3,5-PDC)(DMF)]n (8) and [Ca(3,5-PDC)(H2O)2]n (9) were synthesized under hydro-/solvothermal conditions and/or were produced via solvent recrystn. of previously synthesized compds. The coordination networks reported were characterized using single crystal x-ray diffraction and thermal methods. They show diverse structural topologies, depending on the ligand geometry and coordinated solvent mols., with inorg. connectivity motifs ranging from isolated octahedra to infinite chains, layer and a three-dimensional dense framework. The as-synthesized and desolvated networks further show structural transformation to hydrated phases through dissoln./reformation pathways. The process is likely driven by the high hydration energy of the calcium metal center.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38Xks1Ciu7g%253D&md5=7134b9de75a17dded358e6e9bf1a2b88
      (e) Vakiti, R. K.; Garabato, B. D.; Schieber, N. P.; Cao, Y.; Maddox, J. B.; Pan, W. P.; Yan, B. B. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 3937– 3943

      19e
      Synthesis and Characterization of Two- and Three-Dimensional Calcium Coordination Polymers Built with Benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate and/or Pyrazine-2-carboxylate
      Vakiti, Raj Kishore; Garabato, Brady D.; Schieber, Natalie P.; Rucks, Melinda J.; Cao, Yan; Webb, Cathleen; Maddox, Jeremy B.; Celestian, Aaron; Pan, Wei-Ping; Yan, Bangbo
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (8), 3937-3943CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Two new calcium coordination polymers, [Ca3(btc)2(H2O)12] (1) and [Ca2(btc)(pzc)(H2O)3] (2) (btc = benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate, pzc = pyrazine-2-carboxylate), were synthesized using the hydro/solvothermal method and were characterized using x-ray diffraction, IR, UV-visible, TGA, and fluorescence anal. The structure of compd. 1 is a three-dimensional framework consisting of helical chains of calcium coordination polymers, while that of compd. 2 is a double layered network in which the inorg. zigzag chains of calcium coordination polyhedra are linked by org. ligands. Both compds. show blue fluorescence when excited with UV light. D. functional theory calcns. on electronic absorption spectra of org. ligands and calcium coordination polymers are discussed.

      19f
      A Series of Ca(II) or Ba(II) Inorganic-Organic Hybrid Frameworks Based on Aromatic Polycarboxylate Ligands with the Inorganic M-O-M (M = Ca, Ba) Connectivity from 1D to 3D
      Zhang, Xin; Huang, Yuan-Yuan; Zhang, Ming-Jian; Zhang, Jian; Yao, Yuan-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (6), 3231-3238CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Solvothermal reactions of Ca(NO3)2 or Ba(NO3)2 with arom. carboxylate ligands afforded four new inorg.-org. hybrid frameworks, [Ca(PBDC)(H2O)3]n (1), [Ca(OBDC)(H2O)]n (2), [Ba5(OBDC)4(H2O)2(NO3)2]n (3), and [Ba3(BTC)2(H2O)4]n (4) (H2PBDC = terephthalic acid, H2OBDC = phthalic acid, H3BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid). These compds. were fully characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction, powder X-ray diffraction, satisfactory elemental anal., IR spectra, and TGA. X-ray anal. shows that compd. 1 features a 1-dimensional chain (1D) structure with the I1O0 connectivity, both compd. 2 and compd. 3 feature a two-dimensional (2D) layer structure with the I1O1 connectivity, I2O0 connectivity, resp., compd. 4 features a three-dimensional (3D) framework with a rare I3O0 connectivity. Thermal stabilities and luminescent properties of compds. 1-4 and NLO property of compd. 4 also were studied.

      (h) Gu, Z. G.; Liu, Y. T.; Hong, X. J.; Li, W. S.; Hu, S. J.; Cai, Y. P. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 2178– 2186
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      19h
      Construction of Metal-Imidazole-Based Dicarboxylate Networks with Topological Diversity: Thermal Stability, Gas Adsorption, and Fluorescent Emission Properties
      Gu, Zhi-Gang; Liu, Yi-Ting; Hong, Xu-Jia; Zhan, Qing-Guang; Zheng, Zhi-Peng; Zheng, Sheng-Run; Li, Wei-Shan; Hu, She-Jun; Cai, Yue-Peng
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (5), 2178-2186CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Six new metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), namely, [Pb(H2IDC)2(H2O)]n (1), {[Pb((H2IEDC)2)]·3H2O}n (2), [Ca2(HIDC)2(H2O)]n (3), {[Ca2(IEDC)2(H2O)2]·H2O}n(4), {[Cd(HIDC)(H2O)]n} (5), and {[Cd2(HIEDC)2]·3H2O}n (6) (H3IDC = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid, H3IEDC = 2-ethyl-1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid) were hydrothermally synthesized and characterized. Single-crystal x-ray diffraction shows the ligand H3IDC is partially deprotonated with H2IDC- and HIDC2- forms in three corresponding compds. 1, 3, and 5, meanwhile ligand H3IEDC also presents different deprotonated motifs of H2IEDC-, IEDC3-, and HIEDC2- in 2, 4, and 6, resp. Moreover, these partially or fully deprotonated ligands coordinate in the μ1 to μ5 manner to generate one-dimensional (1D) → three-dimensional (3D) coordination polymers, displaying 10 different coordination modes. Both 1 and 2 have 3D supramol. networks assembled via hydrogen bonding interactions but different in structure topologies. Complex 1 is a 1D coordination chain and 2 has a two-dimensional (2D) wave layer-like structure with 44 topol. Complex 3 is a 3D MOF with 310·425·510 topol. built up from linear 2-connected HIDC2- as a linker and 10-connected tetranuclear metal unit [Ca4(μ2-O)6] as a node. However, complex 4 presents a 2D MOF with 36·46·53 topol. Different from 3 and 4, with the 4-connected binuclear metal unit [Cd(O-C-O)]2 as a node, a wave-like 2D MOF with 44 topol. in 5 based on H3IDC is created. Complex 6 shows a 3D coordination framework contg. 1D alternately arranged hydrophilic channels including (H2O)4 clusters and hydrophobic channels partially occupied by Et groups from imidazole rings, in which the Cd(II) ion is viewed as a 4-connected node, and HIEDC2- and μ2-O are regarded as two different linkers, 6 showing 42·84 topol. Obviously, these results reveal that the existence of the substitute groups of 2-position in such 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylate ligand plays a crit. role in the structural direction of these MOFs. Meanwhile, the adsorption and photoluminescent properties of the selected compds. were studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      20
      Synthesis, structure, and spectroscopic properties of copper(II) compounds containing nitrogen-sulfur donor ligands: the crystal and molecular structure of aqua[1,7-bis(N-methylbenzimidazol-2'-yl)-2,6-dithiaheptane]copper(II) perchlorate
      Addison, Anthony W.; Rao, T. Nageswara; Reedijk, Jan; Van Rijn, Jacobus; Verschoor, Gerrit C.
      Journal of the Chemical Society, Dalton Transactions: Inorganic Chemistry (1972-1999) (1984), (7), 1349-56CODEN: JCDTBI; ISSN:0300-9246.
      The complexes [CuL(OH2)][ClO4]2 (I) and CuL(ClO4)2.2H2O (II) of the linear quadridentate N2S2 donor ligand III (L) were prepd.; they are significantly more stable towards autoredn. than the nonmethyl analogs. The structure of I was detd. by x-ray crystallog.; results were refined to an R of 0.047 for 3343 reflections. The Cu coordination is intermediate between trigonal bipyramidal and square pyramidal. In the solid state the coordination sphere in II may be a topoisomer of I. A new angular structural parameter, τ, is defined as an index of trigonality, a general descriptor of 5-coordinate centric mols. By this criterion the coordination of I in the solid state is described as 48% along the path of distortion from square pyramidal to trigonal bipyramidal. The S → Cu charge-transfer bands in the electronic spectrum of I are assigned. ESR and ligand field spectra show that the Cu compds. adopt a tetragonal structure in donor solvents.

      (a) Wang, Y.-L.; Yuan, D.-Q.; Bi, W.-H.; Li, X.; Li, X.-J.; Li, F.; Cao, R. Cryst. Growth Des. 2005, 5, 1849– 1855

      21a
      Syntheses and Characterizations of Two 3D Cobalt-Organic Frameworks from 2D Honeycomb Building Blocks
      Wang, Yu-Ling; Yuan, Da-Qiang; Bi, Wen-Hua; Li, Xing; Li, Xiao-Ju; Li, Feng; Cao, Rong
      Crystal Growth & Design (2005), 5 (5), 1849-1855CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      The hydrothermal reaction of Co(NO3)2·6H2O, imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid (H3IDC), and 4,4'-bipyridine (bipy) under different conditions affords two interesting metal-org. compds., {[Co3(IDC)2(4,4'-bipy)(H2O)4]·2H2O}n (1) and {[Co3(IDC)2(4,4'-bipy)3]·6H2O·DMF}n (2), both of which have been structurally characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction, elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and thermogravimetric anal. Temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibility for 1 and 2 were also studied. The "all-chair" two-dimensional honeycomb networks, structurally analogous to CFx, were linked by the bridging 4,4'-bipy ligand in compd. 1 to give rise to a 2-fold interpenetrated 3D architecture. Compd. 2 features a three-dimensional open framework with hexagonal channels, generated from two-dimensional graphene-like layers pillared by 4,4'-bipy. The simplest cyclic motif of the 2D networks in 1 and 2 is a 24-membered hexagonal ring consisting of six Co(II) cations and six IDC3- trianions.

      Syntheses, crystal structures and luminescence of two isostructural coordination polymers constructed from 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylate
      Wen, Li-Li; Wang, Dong-E.; Chen, Yu-Jin; Meng, Xiang-Gao; Li, Dong-Feng; Lan, She-Ming
      Journal of Coordination Chemistry (2009), 62 (5), 789-796CODEN: JCCMBQ; ISSN:0095-8972. (Taylor & Francis Ltd.)
      The syntheses, IR, mol. structures, and luminescence of [M(HIMDC)(4,4'-bipyO)0.5(H2O)]n [H3IMDC = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid, 4,4'-bipyO = 4,4'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide, M = Co (1) and Zn (2)] are reported. The most notable structure feature of 1 and 2 is that the left-handed and right-handed helical chains constructed from 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylate and metal are linked by 4,4'-bipyO to generate infinite 2-dimensional herringbone architectures. 2 Exhibits strong fluorescent emission in the solid state at room temp.

      Rational design and control of the dimensions of channels in three-dimensional, porous metal-organic frameworks constructed with predesigned hexagonal layers and pillars
      Li, Cui-Jin; Hu, Sheng; Li, Wei; Lam, Chi-Keung; Zheng, Yan-Zhen; Tong, Ming-Liang
      European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2006), (10), 1931-1935CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      New three-dimensional, microporous metal-org. frameworks, [Co3(imda)2(pyz)3]·8H2O, [Co3(imda)2(4,4'-bipy)3]·4,4'-bipy·8H2O and [Co3(imda)3(2,5-bptz)3]·2,5-bptz·9H2O (imdaH3 = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid; pyz = pyrazine, 4,4'-bipy = 4,4'-bipyridine, 2,5-bptz = 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-thiadiazole), exhibiting reversible H2O adsorption, constructed from hexagonal [Co3(imda)2] layers and N,N'-pillars, in which the dimensions of the channels are rationally adjustable by varying the lengths of pillars, were designed, hydrothermally synthesized, and characterized.

      21d
      Four Three-Dimensional Coordination Polymers Constructed by 2-((1H-1,2,4-Triazol-1-yl)methyl)-1H-Imidazole-4,5-Dicarboxylate: Syntheses, Topological Structures, and Magnetic Properties
      Xie, Li-Xia; Hou, Xiao-Wei; Fan, Yao-Ting; Hou, Hong-Wei
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (3), 1282-1291CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Hydrothermal reactions of Mn(II), Co(II), Cu(II), and Cd(II) salts with 2-((1H-1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)methyl)-1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid (H3tmidc) lead to four novel coordination polymers, namely, [Mn3(tmidc)2(H2O)4]·(H2O)6 (1), [Co3(tmidc)2(H2O)4]·(H2O)4 (2), [Cu3(tmidc)2(H2O)]·(H2O) (3), and [Cd(Htmidc)] (4). Compd. 1 has a three-dimensional (3D) architecture, and the topol. study shows that its framework features a 3D (3,4)-connected fsc-3,4-Pbca network with the Schlaefli topol. symbol of (63)(63.83). Compd. 2 exhibits a 3D pillared framework constructed by 4-fold one-dimensional (1D) helical chains and possesses open helical channels in the framework. Topol. anal. reveals that it is a unique (3,4)-connected net with the Schlaefli symbol of (4.52)(4.5.114) which is not enumerated in RCSR and TOPOS, and has not been reported in the literature. Compd. 3 features a 3D intricate framework displaying a new (3,4)-connected 4-nodal net with the Schlaefli symbol of (5.72)(4.5.7)(52.72.8.10)(4.5.73.8) which has not been obsd. in any other coordination polymers. Topol. anal. of the 3D network found in compd. 4 reveals that the whole structure can be rationalized as a (4.65)(4.65) crb topol. net.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Assembly of two 3-D metal-organic frameworks from Cd(II) and 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid or 2-ethyl-4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid
      Wang, Shuang; Zhang, Lirong; Li, Guanghua; Huo, Qisheng; Liu, Yunling
      CrystEngComm (2008), 10 (11), 1662-1666CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Two new metal-org. frameworks, [Cd3(H2O)2(C5N2O4H)2·H2O] (1) and [KCd(C7N2O4H5)] (2), were hydrothermally synthesized employing 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid (IMDC) and 2-ethyl-4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid (2-EtIMDC) as org. ligands. The single-crystal structure anal. reveals that compd. 1 exhibits a 3-dimensional framework, which is generated from 2-dimensional layers pillared by 1-dimensional chains along the c-axis. Compd. 2 presents a 3-dimensional structure with 1-dimensional channels, which are connected in a cross-like fashion by [CdN2O3] trigonal bipyramid units and 2-EtIMDC ligands.

      22b
      Diversity of Coordination Architecture of Metal 4,5-Dicarboxyimidazole
      Fang, Rui-Qin; Zhang, Xian-Ming
      Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (12), 4801-4810CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Seven complexes of metal imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid (H3dcbi), namely, [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)3]·H2O (1·α), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2]·2H2O (1·β), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2]·2H2O (1·γ), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2] (2), [Cd(Hdcbi)(H2O)] (3), [Cd5(Hdcbi)2(dcbi)2(H2O)]·xH2O (4), [Cd2(Hdcbi)(C2O4)] (5), [Ag5(Hdcbi)2(CN)] (6), and [Mn(Hdcbi)(H2O)] (7), were hydro(solvo)thermally synthesized by fine control over synthetic conditions such as stoichiometry, solvent, and pH value. X-ray single-crystal structural analyses reveal that they have rich structural chem. ranging from mononuclear (1), 1-dimensional (2), and two-dimensional (3 and 7) to three-dimensional (4-6), among which 1 crystallizes in three types (α, β, and γ) of polymorphs. Seven coordination modes of Hndcbi ranging from monodentate to μ5 were obsd., among which four modes are found 1st. The coordination geometries of the Cd(II) sites vary from five-coordinate trigonal bipyramid and square pyramid, six-coordinate octahedron to seven-coordinate pentagonal bipyramid. Analyses of the synthetic conditions and structures of the Cd(II) complexes show that the influences of the solvent and the metal-to-ligand molar ratio are very important to the products and coordination modes of Hndcbi (n = 0, 1, 2). Studies of the coordination modes of Hndcbi and the structures of the Cd(II) complexes also reveal that the singly deprotonated H2dcbi generally coordinates in the monodentate imidazole-N or N,O-chelate mode to result in mononuclear structures, the doubly deprotonated Hdcbi coordinates in the μ2, μ3, or μ4 mode to generate 1-dimensional or two-dimensional structures, and the triply deprotonated dcbi can coordinate in the μ5 mode to form three-dimensional structures. The cyanide was in situ formed via C-C bond cleavage of acetonitrile during the prepn. of 6, which adopts a rare μ4-kC,kC:kN,kN mode to bridge four Ag(I) ions. The microporous three-dimensional framework of 4 is maintained after the removal of the guest mols. Compds. 1-5 show strong violet emissions with maxima around 380 nm, tentatively attributed to the ligand-centered transition.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XksFWit7o%253D&md5=4ba277aa921d8181d3af572ec794f4a2
    23. 23
      (a) Wu, Y. P.; Li, D. S.; Fu, F.; Dong, W. W.; Zhao, J.; Zou, K.; Wang, Y. Y. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 3850– 3857
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      23a
      Stoichiometry of N-Donor Ligand Mediated Assembly in the ZnII-Hfipbb System: From a 2-Fold Interpenetrating Pillared-Network to Unique (3,4)-Connected Isomeric Nets
      Wu, Ya-Pan; Li, Dong-Sheng; Fu, Feng; Dong, Wen-Wen; Zhao, Jun; Zou, Kun; Wang, Yao-Yu
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (9), 3850-3857CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      In this contribution, the authors devote their effort to explore the effect of stoichiometry of the 4,4'-dipyridylsulfide (dps) ligand on the final structures in the ZnII-hfipbb binary system (H2hfipbb = 4,4'-(hexafluoroisopropylidene)bis(HOBz)). The solvothermal reaction of Zn acetate and H2hfipbb with the different stoichiometries of dps from 0.1 to 0.4 mmol resulted in three new coordination polymers, [Zn(hfipbb)(H2hfipbb)0.5]n (1) and [Zn2(hfipbb)2(dps)(H2O)]n (2a and 2b). The structure detn. reveals that complex 1 displays a three-dimensional (3D) 2-fold parallel interpenetrating pillared-layer network with 1-dimensional double left- and right-handed helical tubes. Complexes 2a and 2b are framework-isomeric as two unusual (3,4)-connected 3-dimensional coordination networks, i.e., a 4-nodal (7·82)(4·7·9)(72·84)(4·72·8·92) net and 2-fold interpenetrating (83)2(85·10) net. The properties of TGA, x-ray powder diffraction, and photoluminescent behaviors of the complexes are also discussed.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXpvFCiurw%253D&md5=8150685cb4e000a1343bee6b104aa4e6
      (b) Jia, W. W.; Luo, J. H.; Zhu, M. L. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 2386– 2397
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      23b
      A Molecular Basketwork: Self-Assembly of Coordination Polymers from Zn(II) and Biphenyl-3,4'-dicarboxylate Regulated by Different Flexible Bridging and Chelating N-Donor Ancillary Ligands
      Jia, Weiwei; Luo, Junhua; Zhu, Miaoli
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (6), 2386-2397CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four low-dimensional coordination polymers, [Zn2(bpdc)2(dib)2]n·nH2O (1), [Zn(bpdc)(phen)]n·2nH2O (2), [Zn(bpdc)(bpy)]n·2nH2O (3), and [Zn(bpdc)(H2O)]n (4), (H2bpdc = biphenyl-3,4'-dicarboxylic acid, dib = 1,4-di(imidazol-1-yl)butane, phen = 1,10-phenanthroline, bpy = 2,2'-bipyridine), were successfully prepd. under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by IR, single crystal x-ray diffraction, TGA, and luminescence analyses. Self-assembly behaviors of these polymers were entirely directed by N-donor ancillary coligands (bridging or chelating). Complex 1 displays an interesting novel two-dimensional (2D) basketwork, in which Zn(II) ions are knitted by both org. mols., biphenyl-3,4'-dicarboxylic acid and 1,4-di(imidazol-1-yl)butane, to form an infinite network. Polymers 2 and 3 are infinite zigzag helical chains, and both terminated ligands in 2 and 3 prevent self-assembly to higher dimensional polymers. In 4, a water mol. occupies one of four coordinated positions of Zn(II), and it shows an infinite alternating subloop chains consisting of 8- and 24-membered rings. New coordination modes of the rarely used 3,4-bpdc ligand are reported in 1-4. Different secondary building units could tune the process of self-assembly to form low-dimensional structures, and the obsd. structural motifs can be well regulated by the different chelating or bridging N-donor ancillary ligands. Moreover, complexes 1-4 exhibit strong solid-state luminescence emissions at room temp.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXksFalsbg%253D&md5=7a4d6f66bf884dbb0e8fa0bf7de84e5b
      (c) Zhang, M. D.; Di, C. M.; Qin, L.; Qin, X. Q.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 3957– 3963
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      23c
      Diverse Structures of Metal-Organic Frameworks Based on a New Star-Like Tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine Ligand
      Zhang, Ming-Dao; Di, Chang-Miao; Qin, Ling; Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (8), 3957-3963CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four new metal-org. frameworks based on a new star-like ligand tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine (TPPA), {[Cd(TPPA)(trans-chdc)]}n (1), {[Co(TPPA)2(D-ca)2]·(H2O)}n (2), {[Ni(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (3), {[Ni(TPPA)(trans-chdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (4), (trans-H2chdc = trans-1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid, d-H2ca. = d-camphor acid, H2bdc = benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid), were synthesized under solvothermal conditions. Compd. 1 represents the 1st example of a 4-fold interpenetrating 3-dimensional metal-org. polyrotaxane framework, with {42.65.83}{42.6} AFUQOH topol. In 2, each d-ca2- anion links adjacent Co2+ atoms to a 2-dimensional framework, and only one N atom from each TPPA ligand is involved in coordination, which should be partly attributed to the weak flexibility of the TPPA ligand. Both 3 and 4 reveal 3-fold interpenetrating 3-dimensional frameworks bridged by TPPA ligands and bdc2- (or trans-chdc2-) anions, with {4.62}{43.67} crs topol. Photophys. properties of 1 and the TPPA ligand in the solid state also were studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XpvFensrc%253D&md5=9a291fddb1e3404b412a0e76af7a71cc
    24. 24
      (a) Chen, Z. L.; Jiang, C. F.; Yan, W. H.; Liang, F. P.; Batten, S. R. Inorg. Chem. 2009, 48, 4674– 4684
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      24a
      Three-Dimensional Metal Azide Coordination Polymers with Amino Carboxylate Coligands: Synthesis, Structure, and Magnetic Properties
      Chen, Zi-Lu; Jiang, Chun-Fang; Yan, Wei-Hong; Liang, Fu-Pei; Batten, Stuart R.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2009), 48 (11), 4674-4684CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The reaction of M(II) ions with azido ligands in the presence of different amino carboxylic acids gave four three-dimensional metal-azido coordination polymers, [Mn(3,5-daba)(N3)]n (1), [Cd(3,5-daba)(N3)]n (2; 3,5-daba = 3,5-diaminobenzoate), [Mn(4-aba)(N3)]n (3; 4-aba = 4-aminobenzoate), and [Cu2(gly)2(N3)2]n (4; gly = glycinate), which display different topol. structures. Polymers 1 and 2 present 4,6-connected 3D networks with different Schlafli symbols. However, 3 and 4 feature an unprecedented trinodal 3,6-connected network with the Schlafli symbol (42.6)(4.62)(43.66.86) and an unusual 4-connected 3D net with the Lonsdaleite (hexagonal diamond) topol., resp. Magnetic susceptibility measurements revealed dominant antiferromagnetic couplings for 1 and 3 and an overall dominant ferromagnetic coupling for 4, which presents metamagnetic behavior with a magnetic phase transition at a crit. temp. of 6 K and a transition field of ca. 6030 Oe. The results demonstrate that the EE azido and syn-anti carboxylato bridges in our cases induce an antiferromagnetic interaction, and the anti-anti carboxylato bridge in 4 mediates a ferromagnetic interaction. The magnetic interaction through the EO azido bridge in 3 and 4 has a dependence on the value of the M-N-M bond angle.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvVSksr8%253D&md5=39d3cc0abebbf04641a425e3fb5eb69c
      (b) Mu, Y. J.; Fu, J. H.; Song, Y. J.; Li, Z.; Hou, H. W.; Fan, Y. T. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 2183– 2193
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      24b
      Hydrothermal Syntheses of Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed from Aromatic Polycarboxylate and 4,4'-Bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)biphenyl
      Mu, Yajuan; Fu, Junhong; Song, Yajing; Li, Zhen; Hou, Hongwei; Fan, Yaoting
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (6), 2183-2193CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Six new metal-org. frameworks, namely, {[Co(btmb)(HBTC)]·2H2O}n (1), {[Co3(btmb)3(BTC)2(H2O)2]·6H2O}n (2), {[Co3(btmb)3(BTC)2(H2O)4]·2H2O}n (3), {[Ni3(btmb)3(BTC)2(H2O)4]·2H2O}n (4), [Cu(btmb)(HBTC)]n (5), and [Cu(btmb)(NDC)]n (6) (H3BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid, H2NDC = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylic acid, and btmb = 4,4'-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)biphenyl), were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. The structure of 1 is a 6-connected self-penetrating three-dimensional (3D) framework with 44·610·8 topol. Complex 2 exhibits a trinodal (3,4)-connected topol. with a Schlafli symbol of (62·84)(64·82)(63). Both complexes 3 and 4 possess 3-dimensional pillar-layered structures with a Schlafli symbol of (62·8 × 103)(64·8 × 10)(6 × 102). Complex 5 is also a 3-dimensional polymer with a pillar-layered framework, which can be simplified as the (63)(69·8) topol. Complex 6 shows a 4-connected 3-dimensional framework with a Schlafli notation of (65·8)2. Also, complexes 1-6 as heterogeneous catalysts were studied in the green catalysis process of the oxidative coupling of 2,6-dimethylphenol (DMP) to poly(1,4-phenylene ether) (PPE) and diphenoquinone (DPQ). These complexes exhibit different catalytic activities; both the Cu complexes are catalytically active by showing high conversion of DMP and high selectivity of PPE, and they exhibit great potential as recyclable catalysts.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXlsF2is74%253D&md5=83d20ab96fcc36f4e7e94c18daabd091
      (c) Ma, L. F.; Han, M. L.; Qin, J. H.; Wang, L. Y.; Du, M. Inorg. Chem. 2012, 51, 9431– 9442
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      24c
      MnII Coordination Polymers Based on Bi-, Tri-, and Tetranuclear and Polymeric Chain Building Units: Crystal Structures and Magnetic Properties
      Ma, Lu-Fang; Han, Min-Le; Qin, Jian-Hua; Wang, Li-Ya; Du, Miao
      Inorganic Chemistry (2012), 51 (17), 9431-9442CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Five new MnII coordination polymers, [Mn2(tbip)2(bix)] (1), [Mn3(tbip)3(bix)2] (2), [Mn3(tbip)2(Htbip)2(bib)2]·4H2O (3), [Mn4(tbip)4(bbp)2(H2O)] (4), and [Mn4(tbip)4(bip)]·2H2O (5), were prepd. by hydrothermal reactions of Mn(II) acetate with H2tbip (5-tert-butylisophthalic acid) in the presence of different di-imidazolyl coligands (bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, bib = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-yl)butane, bbp = 1,3-bis(benzimidazol-1-yl)propane, bip = 1,3-bis(imidazol-1-yl)propane). All complexes were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectra, TGA, single-crystal x-ray crystallog., and powder X-ray diffraction. Single crystal x-ray studies show that these coordination polymers contain homometallic clusters varying from dimeric, trimeric, and tetrameric motifs to polymeric chains depending upon the coligands used. Complex 1 has a 3-dimensional 6-connected polycatenane network with dinuclear [Mn2O2] secondary building units. Complex 2 possesses a 3-dimensional 8-connected structure with trinuclear [Mn3(COO)6] units. Complex 3 shows a 3-dimensional pcu net based on trinuclear [Mn3(COO)6] clusters as nodes. Complex 4 features a 3-dimensional 8-connected structure constructed from the distorted square-grid tetranuclear [Mn4(μ2-COO)8(μ2-H2O)] units. Complex 5 shows a 3-dimensional (4,5,6)-connected net contg. 1-dimensional μ-O/μ-COO alternately bridged chains. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicate that complexes 1 and 3-5 show weak antiferromagnetic interactions between the adjacent MnII ions, whereas 2 is a three-spin center homometallic ferromagnetic system.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38Xht1egtrjE&md5=d306f0fe8f4748325fe56b400ec14b43
      (d) Qin, L.; Hu, J. S.; Li, Y. Z.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 403– 413
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      24d
      Effect of Carboxylate Coligands with Different Rigidity on Supramolecular Architectures Based on One Rigid Didentate Linear Ligand
      Qin, Ling; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (1), 403-413CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Six new metal-org. frameworks, namely, {[Cd(bpbenz)(pim)] }n (1), {[Cd(bpbenz)(sea)]·(H2O)2}n (2), {[Cd(bpbenz)(hfipbb)]·(H2O)3}n (3), {[Co(bpbenz)(4,4'-sdb)]·(H2O)2.75}n (4), {[Ni(bpbenz)(4,4'-sdb) (H2O)3]·(H2O)2}n (5), and {[Co(bpbenz)(Hbtc)]·(H2O) }n (6), [bpbenz = 1,4-bis(4-pyridyl)benzene, pim = pimelic acid, sea = sebacic acid, H2hfipbb = 4,4'-(hexafluoroisopropylidene)bis(benzoic acid), 4,4'-H2sdb = 4,4'-sulfonyldibenzoic acid, H3btc = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid], have been synthesized under solvothermal conditions (DMF/H2O; DMF = N,N-dimethylacetamide). These compds. were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and x-ray single-crystal diffraction. Compd. 1 is a 3D network composed of layers of pentagonal-bipyramidal coordinated Cd atoms bridged by pimelic anions in syn-anti configurations and bpbenz mols. between layers with {412.63} pcu topol. In compd. 2, the bpbenz and sebacic anions act as bidentate ligands assembling with Cd(NO3)2 to a 2D framework. Compd. 3 is a 2D network composed of chains, which is bridged by the [Cd2(CO2)4]2L2 SBUs and hfipbb2- anions, and with bpbenz mols. between chains. For compd. 4, the bpbenz and 4,4'-sdb coordinate to Co cations to form a three-dimensional {65.8} cds uninodal network. Compd. 5 features 2D structure with inclined polycatenation (1D + 1D → 2D). For compd. 6, a 2D network with side arms gives a polythreaded network, which exhibits a 2-fold interpenetrating 3D array if H-bonds are taken into account. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicate that compds. 4 and 6 have dominating antiferromagnetic couplings between metal ions. Furthermore, thermal stabilities for 1-6 and luminescent properties for 1-3 are also discussed.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXhsFSjsbbF&md5=6cff4364528f221946605967b5f7a5a2

      (a) Pan, L.; Frydel, T.; Sander, M. B.; Huang, X.; Li, J. Inorg. Chem. 2001, 40, 1271– 1283
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      25a
      The Effect of pH on the Dimensionality of Coordination Polymers
      Pan, Long; Frydel, Thomas; Sander, Michelle B.; Huang, Xiaoying; Li, Jing
      Inorganic Chemistry (2001), 40 (6), 1271-1283CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Hydrothermal reactions of simple alk. earth salts or their hydroxides with 3,5-pyrazoledicarboxylic acid (H3pdc) yielded seven new compds. At a lower pH level three 1-dimensional structures [Ca(Hpdc)(H2O)4]·2H2O (1), [Ca(Hpdc)(H2O)4]·H2O (2), and [Ba(H2pdc)2(H2O)4]·2H2O (6) were obtained by evapn. of the solns. resulting from hydro(solvo)thermal reactions of MCl2 (M = Ca, Ba) with H3pdc in H2O (1, 6) or in H2O/Et3N (2) at 150° for 3 days. Crystal structures of 1 and 2 contain zigzag chains of metal centers bridged by a single Hpdc2- ligand, whereas structure 6 consists of linear chains of metal centers bridged by two H2pdc- ligands. A dimer mol. [Sr(H3pdc)(H2pdc)2(H2O)3]2·2(H3pdc)·4H2O (4) was obtained from a similar hydrothermal reaction using Sr(ClO4)2·6H2O instead of MCl2. This compd. contains [2+2] metallomacrocycles. At higher pH levels (pH = 4-6), the three-dimensional polymers [M(Hpdc)(H2O)] (Ca 3, Sr 5, Ba 7 ) were isolated by reactions of MCl2 (M = Ca, Sr, Ba) with H3pdc in H2O/Et3N or in M(OH)2 (M = Ca, Sr, Ba) with H3pdc in H2O under hydro(solvo)thermal conditions (150°, 3 days). Ca and Sr are seven- and nine-coordinated in 3 and 5, resp.; Ba is nine- and ten-coordinated in 7. The increase in pH resulted in a higher connectivity level of ligands, which in turn leads to a higher dimensionality of the crystal structures. The correlation between the structures and pH values are discussed. Crystal data: for 1, monoclinic, space group P21/n, with a 8.382(2), b 12.621(3), c 11.767(2) Å, β 98.91(3)°, Z = 4; for 2, 3, and 5, monoclinic, space group P21/c, Z = 4, a 7.711(2), b 15.574(3), c 9.341(2) Å, β 96.73(3)°, Z = 4(2) (2), a 6.616(1), b 12.654(3), c 8.782(2) Å, β 103.65(3)°, Z = 4(3) (3), a 9.213(2), b 12.088(3), c 6.196(2) Å, β 98.96(3)° (5); for 4 and 7, triclinic, space group P‾1, with a 11.263(2), b 11.460(3), c 12.904(2) Å, α 71.54(3), β 98.96(3), γ 89.03(3)°, Z = 1(4) (4), a 7.107(1), b 9.780(2), c 11.431(2) Å, α 74.69(3), β 73.39(3), γ 85.29(3)°, Z = 2(7) (7); for 6, monoclinic, space group C2/c, with a 20.493(4), b 6.708(1), c 15.939(3) Å, β 123.56(3)°, Z = 4.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXhtFGmu7k%253D&md5=c8de524882b0c4a270209ae0e211b865
      (b) Ghosh, A.; Rao, K. P.; Sanguramath, R. A.; Rao, C. N. R. J. Mol. Struct. 2009, 927, 37– 42
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      25b
      Two- and three-dimensional lead-1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylates
      Ghosh, Anupama; Prabhakara Rao, K.; Sanguramath, R. A.; Rao, C. N. R.
      Journal of Molecular Structure (2009), 927 (1-3), 37-42CODEN: JMOSB4; ISSN:0022-2860. (Elsevier B.V.)
      Reaction of lead nitrate and 1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid under hydrothermal conditions carried out at different temps. and pH yields a hybrid compd. Pb2(1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylate)2, I, and a three-dimensional coordination polymer Pb(1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylate), II. The two-dimensional double-layered compd., I, with two-dimensional inorg. connectivities and 1-dimensional org. connectivity is novel since hybrid compds. formed by 1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid are uncommon. The Pb atoms in I have holodirectional geometry, while those in II show hemidirectionality. In both I and II, 1H-imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid acts as a multi-dentate ligand with both the carboxylic groups and the amine group taking part in coordination.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXmtVCjur8%253D&md5=ab53cfa1e080071ef424424d22c2f063

      ARTICLE SECTIONS
      Jump To

      This article references 25 other publications.

      1. 1
        (a) Leininger, S.; Olenyuk, B.; Stang, P. J. Chem. Rev. 2000, 100, 853– 908
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1a
        Self-Assembly of Discrete Cyclic Nanostructures Mediated by Transition Metals
        Leininger, Stefan; Olenyuk, Bogdan; Stang, Peter J.
        Chemical Reviews (Washington, D. C.) (2000), 100 (3), 853-907CODEN: CHREAY; ISSN:0009-2665. (American Chemical Society)
        A review with 249 refs. discusses the self-assembly of discrete cyclic nanostructures mediated by transition metals in light of (1) design principles, 2-dimensional mol. polygons, including rhomboids, helicates, mol. triangles and squares and rectangles, (2) 3-dimensional nanoscopic cages and polyhedra, (3) challenges in characterization of large supramols. and (4) potential applications for metal-based polygons and polyhedra.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3cXotlynsg%253D%253D&md5=4f83c0377201b2bfb698a161686ada2d
        (b) Moulton, B.; Zaworotko, M. J. Chem. Rev. 2001, 101, 1629– 1658
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1b
        From molecules to crystal engineering. Supramolecular isomerism and polymorphism in network solids
        Moulton, Brian; Zaworotko, Michael J.
        Chemical Reviews (Washington, D. C.) (2001), 101 (6), 1629-1658CODEN: CHREAY; ISSN:0009-2665. (American Chemical Society)
        A review with 299 refs. on how the advances in supramol. chem. have impacted the manner in which chemists view the existence of single crystals and the design of new cryst. phases. Coordination polymers, H-bonded networks, and supramol. isomerism and polymorphism are considered.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXjtlyqtrg%253D&md5=00fbfe863055d07d1773be77dc52f023
        (c) Janiak, C. Dalton Trans. 2003, 2781– 2804
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1c
        Engineering coordination polymers towards applications
        Janiak, Christoph
        Dalton Transactions (2003), (14), 2781-2804CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review. The development in the field of coordination polymers or metal-org. coordination networks, MOCNs (metal-org. frameworks, MOFs) is assessed in terms of property studies in the areas of catalysis, chirality, cond., luminescence, magnetism, spin-transition (spin-crossover), nonlinear optics (NLO) and porosity or zeolitic behavior upon which potential applications could be based.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXlt1emsb4%253D&md5=6eecd48505926400514d22bd2ffd5c1f
        (d) Kitagawa, S.; Kitaura, R.; Noro, S. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2004, 43, 2334– 2375
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1d
        Functional porous coordination polymers
        Kitagawa, Susumu; Kitaura, Ryo; Noro, Shin-ichiro
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2004), 43 (18), 2334-2375CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        A review. Discussion concs. on three aspects of coordination polymers: (1) the use of crystal engineering to construct porous frameworks from connectors and linkers (nano-space engineering), (2) characterizing and cataloging the porous properties by functions for storage, exchange, sepn., etc., and (3) the next generation of porous functions based on dynamic crystal transformations caused by guest mols. or phys. stimuli. The authors' aim is to present the state of the art chem. and physics of and in the micropores of porous coordination polymers.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXktFShtLk%253D&md5=9df52e99bad3cc0db67f65551a8c154f
        (e) Steel, P. J. Acc. Chem. Res. 2005, 38, 243– 250
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1e
        Ligand Design in Multimetallic Architectures: Six Lessons Learned
        Steel, Peter J.
        Accounts of Chemical Research (2005), 38 (4), 243-250CODEN: ACHRE4; ISSN:0001-4842. (American Chemical Society)
        A review. Metallosupramol. chem. involves the use of combinations of org. ligands and metals for the construction of both discrete and polymeric aggregates. This Account describes some lessons that the authors learned about aspects of ligand design in the authors' work in this area. Specifically, the authors recommend the incorporation of a diverse range of heterocyclic rings and arene cores within the ligands, as well as attention to symmetry considerations, and offer suggestions for the introduction of chirality and flexibility within the ligands and the exploitation of other weak interactions to assist self-assembly processes.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXptlSjtQ%253D%253D&md5=533d15ec1e8b29ed2c3c8ba237227772
        (f) Cheng, J. K.; Chen, Y. B.; Wu, L.; Zhang, J.; Wen, Y. H.; Li, Z. J.; Yao, Y. G. Inorg. Chem. 2005, 44, 3386– 3388
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1f
        A 3-D Noninterpenetrating Diamondoid Network of a Decanuclear Copper(I) Complex
        Cheng, Jian-Kai; Chen, Yu-Biao; Wu, Ling; Zhang, Jian; Wen, Yi-Hang; Li, Zhao-Ji; Yao, Yuan-Gen
        Inorganic Chemistry (2005), 44 (10), 3386-3388CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        The solvothermal reaction of CuCl2·2H2O with pyridine-4-thiol and EtOH yielded a novel photoluminescent 3-dimensional polymeric complex, [Cu10Cl10L4]n (L = pyridine-4-thiol) with an interesting decorated diamondoid network that is constructed of decanuclear Cu(I) cluster units and μ4-Cl ligands. The complex is tetragonal, space group I4(1)/a, Z = 8. The in situ generation of CuSO4·5H2O implies the spontaneous occurrence of desulfurization and redox reactions in the present system.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXjtl2is70%253D&md5=6a0513ea08dcbb28fc3777d75870f936
        (g) Maes, M.; Alaerts, L.; Vermoortele, F.; Ameloot, R.; Couck, S.; Finsy, V.; Denayer, J. F. M. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2010, 132, 2284– 2292
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1g
        Separation of C5-Hydrocarbons on Microporous Materials: Complementary Performance of MOFs and Zeolites
        Maes, Michael; Alaerts, Luc; Vermoortele, Frederik; Ameloot, Rob; Couck, Sarah; Finsy, Vincent; Denayer, Joeri F. M.; De Vos, Dirk E.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2010), 132 (7), 2284-2292CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        This work studies the liq.-phase sepn. of the aliph. C5-diolefins, mono-olefins, and paraffins, a typical feed produced by a steam cracker, with a focus on the seldomly studied sepn. of the C5-diolefin isomers isoprene, trans-piperylene, and cis-piperylene. Three adsorbents are compared: the metal-org. framework MIL-96, which is an aluminum 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate, and two zeolites with CHA and LTA topol. All three materials have spacious cages that are accessible via narrow cage windows with a diam. of less than 0.5 nm. The mechanisms detg. adsorption selectivities on the various materials are investigated. Within the diolefin fraction, MIL-96 and chabazite preferentially adsorb trans-piperylene from a mixt. contg. all three C5-diolefin isomers with high sepn. factors and a higher capacity compared to the ref. zeolite 5A due to a more efficient packing of the trans isomer in the pores. Addnl., chabazite is able to sep. cis-piperylene and isoprene based on size exclusion of the branched isomer. This makes chabazite suitable for sepg. all three diolefin isomers. Its use in sepg. linear from branched mono-olefins and paraffins is addressed as well. Furthermore, MIL-96 is the only material capable of sepg. all three diolefin isomers from C5-mono-olefins and paraffins. Finally, the MOF [Cu3(BTC)2] (BTC = benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate) is able to sep. C5-olefins from paraffins. On the basis of these observations, a flow scheme can be devised in which the C5-fraction can be completely sepd. using a combination of MOFs and zeolites.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXhtlCgtL4%253D&md5=7b01c96152d13afbc6d94c73ccd43713
        (h) Sculley, J.; Yuan, D.; Zhou, H.-C. Energy Environ. Sci. 2011, 4, 2721– 2735

        1h
        The current status of hydrogen storage in metal-organic frameworks-updated
        Sculley, Julian; Yuan, Daqiang; Zhou, Hong-Cai
        Energy & Environmental Science (2011), 4 (8), 2721-2735CODEN: EESNBY; ISSN:1754-5706. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review. Hydrogen storage in metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), or porous coordination polymers, has been extensively investigated in the last two years and this review is to serve as an up to date account of the recent progress. The effects of MOF sample prepn. and activation, functionalization (including post-synthetic), catenation, unsatd. metal sites, metal doping and spillover have been discussed using recent examples. In addn. to a condensed ref. table of all recently reported MOFs for hydrogen storage, future directions are discussed based on promising new materials and reported computational analyses.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        1i
        Solvatochromic Behavior of a Nanotubular Metal-Organic Framework for Sensing Small Molecules
        Lu, Zhen-Zhong; Zhang, Rui; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2011), 133 (12), 4172-4174CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A nanotubular metal-org. framework (MOF), {[(WS4Cu4)I2(dptz)3]·DMF}n (dptz = 3,6-di(pyridin-4-yl)-1,2,4,5-tetrazine, DMF = DMF) for sensing small solvent mols. is presented. When accommodating different solvent mols. as guests, the resulting inclusion compds. exhibit different colors depending on the solvent guests, and more interestingly, the band gaps of these solvent-included complexes are in linear correlation with the polarity of the guest solvents. The solvent mols. can be sensed by the changes of UV-visible spectra of the corresponding inclusion compds., showing a new way of signal transduction as a new kind of sensor. The sensing by such a MOF occurs within the channel-contg. material rather than on the external surface.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        (j) Zhong, D. C.; Deng, J. H.; Luo, X. Z.; Liu, H. J.; Zhong, J. L.; Wang, K. J.; Lu, T. B. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 1992– 1998

        1j
        Two Cadmium-Cluster-Based Metal-Organic Frameworks with Mixed Ligands of 1,2,3-Benzenetriazole (HBTA) and 1,4-Benzenedicarboxylic acid (H2BDC)
        Zhong, Di-Chang; Deng, Ji-Hua; Luo, Xu-Zhong; Liu, Hui-Jin; Zhong, Jin-Lian; Wang, Ke-Jun; Lu, Tong-Bu
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (4), 1992-1998CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Two cadmium(II) metal-org. frameworks based on two mixed ligands of HBTA and H2BDC, [Cd5(BTA)6(BDC)2(DMF)4(H2O)2]n·n(2DMF·H2O) (1) and [Cd7(BTA)2(BDC)6(DMF)8]n·2nDMF (2) (HBTA = 1,2,3-benzotriazole; H2BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid), were prepd. through methods of liq. to liq. diffusion and solvothermal reaction, resp. The results of single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses indicate that both MOFs are constructed from cadmium clusters. In 1, six BTA- anions connect five Cd(II) ions to generate a tetrahedral Cd5 cluster, which further links with four equiv. Cd5 clusters through four BDC2- bridges, forming a (4,4)-connected two-dimensional (2D) layer structure. In 2, each BTA- anion connects three Cd(II) ions to generate a triangular Cd3 cluster, which further links with four Cd3 clusters and two 3-connected BDC2- anions, forming a (3,6)-connected three-dimensional (3D) framework. The results of photoluminescent measurements illustrate that in the solid state, both 1 and 2 emit fluorescence at 465 and 450 nm, resp.

        1k
        Gyroidal Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Zhou, Xiao-Ping; Li, Mian; Liu, Jie; Li, Dan
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2012), 134 (1), 67-70CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        The gyroid is ubiquitous for underlying the construction of natural substance and artificial zeolites, but it has been, surprisingly, overlooked by chemists who work in the field of metal-org. frameworks (MOFs). Gyroidal MOFs, MLn, with gie topol., constructed from 1,2-bis((5H-imidazol-4-yl)methylene)hydrazine (H2L) and the octahedral metal ions ZnII, MnII, CuII, and NiII, were synthesized and characterized by x-ray crystallog. The ZnII analog, named as STU-1, shows exceptional thermal and chem. stabilities, and exhibits permanent porosity and CO2 capture ability.

        2a
        Permanent Microporosity and Enantioselective Sorption in a Chiral Open Framework
        Bradshaw, Darren; Prior, Timothy J.; Cussen, Edmund J.; Claridge, John B.; Rosseinsky, Matthew J.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2004), 126 (19), 6106-6114CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A homochiral microporous material is presented. The phase has 47% permanently porous void vol. and is shown to have >1 nm diam. pores with three-dimensional channels using probe mol. sorption. Enantioselective guest sorption is strongly dependent on guest size. The homochiral microporous phase was identified by reactive selection from a first-generation chiral but nonporous framework. Chiral permanent porosity is established by directional noncovalent interactions between framework-forming and nonframework forming components of the stable second-generation material, which become stronger upon loss of the guests from the pore system.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXjsVCiu78%253D&md5=6be16cce42754fbc1956636f3580d0ee
        (b) Li, J.-R.; Kuppler, R. J.; Zhou, H.-C. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1477– 1504
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2b
        Selective gas adsorption and separation in metal-organic frameworks
        Li, Jian-Rong; Kuppler, Ryan J.; Zhou, Hong-Cai
        Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1477-1504CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review. Adsorptive sepn. is very important in industry. Generally, the process uses porous solid materials such as zeolites, activated carbons, or silica gels as adsorbents. With an ever increasing need for a more efficient, energy-saving, and environmentally benign procedure for gas sepn., adsorbents with tailored structures and tunable surface properties must be found. Metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), constructed by metal-contg. nodes connected by org. bridges, are such a new type of porous materials. They are promising candidates as adsorbents for gas sepns. due to their large surface areas, adjustable pore sizes and controllable properties, as well as acceptable thermal stability. This crit. review starts with a brief introduction to gas sepn. and purifn. based on selective adsorption, followed by a review of gas selective adsorption in rigid and flexible MOFs. Based on possible mechanisms, selective adsorptions obsd. in MOFs are classified, and primary relationships between adsorption properties and framework features are analyzed. As a specific example of tailor-made MOFs, mesh-adjustable mol. sieves are emphasized and the underlying working mechanism elucidated. In addn. to the exptl. aspect, theor. investigations from adsorption equil. to diffusion dynamics via mol. simulations are also briefly reviewed. Furthermore, gas sepns. in MOFs, including the mol. sieving effect, kinetic sepn., the quantum sieving effect for H2/D2 sepn., and MOF-based membranes are also summarized (227 refs.).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvVamurY%253D&md5=cbb650af8ce92526fc8ffd870218bbd0
        (c) Perman, J. A.; Zaworotko, M. J. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1400– 1417
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2c
        Design and synthesis of metal-organic frameworks using metal-organic polyhedra as supermolecular building blocks
        Perry, John J., IV; Perman, Jason A.; Zaworotko, Michael J.
        Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1400-1417CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        This crit. review highlights supermol. building blocks (SBBs) in the context of their impact upon the design, synthesis, and structure of metal-org. materials (MOMs). MOMs, also known as coordination polymers, hybrid inorg.-org. materials, and metal-org. frameworks, represent an emerging class of materials that have attracted the imagination of solid-state chemists because MOMs combine unprecedented levels of porosity with a range of other functional properties that occur through the metal moiety and/or the org. ligand. First generation MOMs exploited the geometry of metal ions or secondary building units (SBUs), small metal clusters that mimic polygons, for the generation of MOMs. In this crit. review we examine the recent (<5 years) adoption of much larger scale metal-org. polyhedra (MOPs) as SBBs for the construction of MOMs by highlighting how the large size and high symmetry of such SBBs can afford improved control over the topol. of the resulting MOM and a new level of scale to the resulting framework (204 refs.).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvValsr4%253D&md5=296a7ae534acdc37203ce097b2013d18
        (d) Furukawa, H.; Ko, N.; Aratani, N.; Choi, S. B.; Choi, E.; Yazaydin, A. O.; Snurr, R. Q.; O ’Keeffe, M.; Kim, J.; Yaghi, O. M. Science 2010, 329, 424– 428
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2d
        Ultrahigh Porosity in Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Furukawa, Hiroyasu; Ko, Nakeun; Go, Yong Bok; Aratani, Naoki; Choi, Sang Beom; Choi, Eunwoo; Yazaydin, A. Oezguer; Snurr, Randall Q.; O'Keeffe, Michael; Kim, Jaheon; Yaghi, Omar M.
        Science (Washington, DC, United States) (2010), 329 (5990), 424-428CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075. (American Association for the Advancement of Science)
        Cryst. solids with extended non-interpenetrating three-dimensional crystal structures were synthesized that support well-defined pores with internal diams. of up to 48 angstroms. The Zn4O(CO2)6 unit was joined with either one or two kinds of org. link, 4,4',4''-[benzene-1,3,5-triyl-tris(ethyne-2,1-diyl)]tribenzoate (BTE), 4,4',44''-[benzene-1,3,5-triyl-tris(benzene-4,1-diyl)]tribenzoate (BBC), 4,4',44''-benzene-1,3,5-triyl-tribenzoate (BTB)/2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylate (NDC), and BTE/biphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylate (BPDC), to give four metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), MOF-180, -200, -205, and -210, resp. Members of this series of MOFs show exceptional porosities and gas (hydrogen, methane, and carbon dioxide) uptake capacities. For example, MOF-210 has Brunauer-Emmett-Teller and Langmuir surface areas of 6240 and 10,400 square meters per g, resp., and a total carbon dioxide storage capacity of 2870 mg per g. The vol.-specific internal surface area of MOF-210 (2060 square meters per cubic centimeter) is equiv. to the outer surface of nanoparticles (3-nm cubes) and near the ultimate adsorption limit for solid materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        (e) Pachfule, P.; Das, R.; Poddar, P.; Banerjee, R. Inorg. Chem. 2011, 50, 3855– 3865

        2e
        Structural, Magnetic, and Gas Adsorption Study of a Series of Partially Fluorinated Metal-Organic Frameworks (HF-MOFs)
        Pachfule, Pradip; Das, Raja; Poddar, Pankaj; Banerjee, Rahul
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2011), 50 (9), 3855-3865CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Four new partially fluorinated metal org. frameworks (HF-MOFs) were synthesized under different solvothermal conditions (H2O or DMF) from transition metal cations [Co2+ and Mn2+], 3-methylpyridine (3-mepy) and 4,4'-(hexafluoroisopropylidene)bis(benzoic acid) (C17H10F6O4, H2hfbba), to det. the influence of reaction conditions on the formation of MOFs. This family of materials displays a striking degree of structural similarity depending on the solvent of synthesis. HF-MOFs synthesized from H2O [Co-HFMOF-W, Co(hfbba)(3-mepy)(H2O) and Mn-HFMOF-W, Mn(hfbba)(3-mepy)(H2O)] contain three-dimensional connectivity whereas HF-MOFs synthesized from DMF Co-HFMOF-D, [Co2(hfbba)2(3-mepy)2]·(DMF)3 and Mn-HFMOF-D, [Mn2(hfbba)2(3-mepy)]·(H2O) are two-dimensional in nature. Co-HFMOF-W and Mn-HFMOF-W are iso-structural polymeric materials. TGA performed on as-synthesized HF-MOFs revealed that these compds. have high thermal stability (∼ 350°). The continuous decrease of the χT product with decreasing T for Co-HFMOF-D and Co-HFMOF-W resp. indicates antiferromagnetic exchange interaction between two Co2+ (S = 3/2) metal centers within a cluster.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        2f
        Three-Dimensional Porous Cd(II) Coordination Polymer with Large One-Dimensional Hexagonal Channels: High Pressure CH4 and H2 Adsorption Studies
        Sharma, Manish K.; Senkovska, Irena; Kaskel, Stefan; Bharadwaj, Parimal K.
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2011), 50 (2), 539-544CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        A new porous and hydrothermally stable three-dimensional (3D) coordination polymer {[Cd(bpydb)]·6H2O}n (1) was synthesized under solvothermal condition from a new rigid ligand 4,4'-(4,4'-bipyridine-2,6-diyl)dibenzoic acid (H2bpydb) and Cd(NO3)2·6H2O. Single crystal x-ray anal. shows that 1 has a 5-connected 4466vma net with one-dimensional (1D) hexagonal channels filled with water mols. Integrity of the framework is maintained upon removal of the water mols. by heating to result in a porous framework. Low pressure N2 and high pressure H2 and CH4 sorption studies along with water adsorption studies were performed on this framework.

        High Separation Capacity and Selectivity of C2 Hydrocarbons over Methane within a Microporous Metal-Organic Framework at Room Temperature
        He, Yabing; Zhang, Zhangjing; Xiang, Shengchang; Wu, Hui; Fronczek, Frank R.; Zhou, Wei; Krishna, Rajamani; O'Keeffe, Michael; Chen, Banglin
        Chemistry - A European Journal (2012), 18 (7), 1901-1904, S1901/1-S1901/25CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        A newly prepd. copper org. framework [Cu3(H2L)(H2O)3]·3DEF·2.5H2O (H8L = 1,2,4,5-tetra(5-isophthalate)benzene; UTSA-34, UTSA = University of Texas at San Antonio) is constructed from the paddlewheel Cu2(CO2)4 secondary building units and the expanded octacarboxylate org. linkers as characterized by crystal structure anal. The permanent microporosities were established for both partially UTSA-34a and completely desolvated MOFs UTSA-34b and their C1 and C2 hydrocarbon sorption isotherms were measured to establish their potential for selective sepn. The authors further examd. the sepn. selectivity and capacity of UTSA-34b for C2H2/CH4, C2H4/CH4, and C2H6/CH4 binary mixts. at 296 K. Such high sepn. capacity and selectivity are attributed to the moderately high pore spaces within the framework to take up a large amt. of hydrocarbons and open Cu metal sites on the pore surfaces for their stronger interactions with C2H2 and C2H4.

        3a
        A Novel, Highly Electrical Conducting, Single-Component Molecular Material: [Ag2(ophen)2] (Hophen = 1H-[1,10]phenanthrolin-2-one)
        Zheng, Shao-Liang; Zhang, Jie-Peng; Wong, Wing-Tak; Chen, Xiao-Ming
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2003), 125 (23), 6882-6883CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        This communication describes a highly conducting, single-component mol. material [Ag2(ophen)2] (Hophen = 1H-[1,10]phenanthrolin-2-one) based on very strong off-set π-π stacking interactions with an unusually short ring-to-ring distance of ca. 3.15 Å between adjacent mols. and silver(I)-π interactions with the Ag···C contact of 3.082 Å between adjacent mols. The title compd., having a room-temp. cond. of 14 S cm-1, is structurally different from both the known conducting single-component mol. materials of transition-metal complexes with sulfur-contg. π-delocalized dithiolene ligands and the known conducting multicomponent organosilver(I) materials.

        (d) Du, Y.; Chen, C. G.; Wang, E. Anal. Chem. 2010, 82, 1556– 1563
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3d
        Solid-State Probe Based Electrochemical Aptasensor for Cocaine: A Potentially Convenient, Sensitive, Repeatable, and Integrated Sensing Platform for Drugs
        Du, Yan; Chen, Chaogui; Yin, Jianyuan; Li, Bingling; Zhou, Ming; Dong, Shaojun; Wang, Erkang
        Analytical Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2010), 82 (4), 1556-1563CODEN: ANCHAM; ISSN:0003-2700. (American Chemical Society)
        Aptamers, which are artificial oligonucleotides selected in vitro, have been employed to design novel biosensors (i.e., aptasensors). The authors first constructed a label-free electrochem. aptasensor introducing a probe immobilization technique by the use of a layer-by-layer (LBL) self-assembled multilayer with ferrocene-appended poly(ethyleneimine) (Fc-PEI) on an indium tin oxide (ITO) array electrode for detection of cocaine. The Fc-PEI and gold nanoparticles (AuNPs) were LBL assembled on the electrode surface via electrostatic interaction. Then, cocaine aptamer fragments, SH-C2, were covalently labeled onto the outermost AuNP layer. When the target cocaine and cocaine aptamer C1 were present simultaneously, the SH-C2 layer hybridized partly with C1 to bind the cocaine, which led to a decreased differential pulse voltammetry (DPV) signal of Fc-PEI. This DPV signal change could be used to sensitively detect cocaine with the lowest detectable concn. down to 0.1 μM and the detection range up to 38.8 μM, which falls in the expected range for medical use of detecting drug abuse involving cocaine. Meanwhile, the sensor was specific to cocaine in complex biol. fluids such as human plasma, human saliva, etc. The sensing strategy had general applicability, and the detection of thrombin could also be realized, displayed a low detection limit, and exhibited worthiness to other analytes. The aptasensor based on the array electrode held promising potential for integration of the sensing ability in multianal. for simultaneous detection.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        Cation Exchange Induced Tunable Properties of a Nanoporous Octanuclear Cu(II) Wheel with Double-Helical Structure
        Zhao, Jin'an; Mi, Liwei; Hu, Jiyong; Hou, Hongwei; Fan, Yaoting
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2008), 130 (46), 15222-15223CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A double-helical octanuclear Cu(II) wheel [Cu8L16] (1) with 2.88 nm diam. was prepd. through the reaction of a clin. medicine, telmisartan (HL), with copper sulfate. Central copper ions can be partially replaced by bivalent zinc and cobalt ions to generate [Zn1.6Cu6.4L16] (2) and [Co1.2Cu6.8L16] (3), resp., and fully exchanged by trivalent iron ions. The properties of central metal ion-exchanged variants are much different from those of 1. The mol. structures of 1 and 2 were detd. using X-ray crystallog., and their antitumor activities were detd., as well. The ability of complexes 1-3 to catalyze the oxidative self-coupling of 2,6-di-tert-butylphenol was investigated, as was their hydrogen sorption abilities. Finally, the DNA binding abilities of 1 were investigated.

        4b
        High Gas Sorption and Metal-Ion Exchange of Microporous Metal-Organic Frameworks with Incorporated Imide Groups
        Prasad, Thazhe Kootteri; Hong, Dae Ho; Suh, Myunghyun Paik
        Chemistry--A European Journal (2010), 16 (47), 14043-14050, S14043/1-S14043/27CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), [Cu2(bdcppi)(DMF)2]·10DMF·2H2On (SNU-50) and [Zn2(bdcppi)(DMF)3]·6DMF·4H2On (SNU-51), were prepd. by the solvothermal reactions of N,N'-bis(3,5-dicarboxyphenyl)pyromellitic diimide (H4BDCPPI) with Cu(NO3)2 and Zn(NO3)2, resp. Framework SNU-50 has an NbO-type net structure, whereas SNU-51 has a PtS-type net structure. Desolvated solid [Cu2(bdcppi)]n (SNU-50'), which was prepd. by guest exchange of SNU-50 with acetone followed by evacuation at 170°, adsorbs high amts. of N2, H2, O2, CO2, and CH4 gases due to the presence of a vacant coordination site at every metal ion, and to the presence of imide groups in the ligand. The Langmuir surface area is 2450 m2 g-1. It adsorbs H2 gas up to 2.10% at 1 atm and 77 K, with zero coverage isosteric heat of 7.1 kJ mol-1, up to a total of 7.85% at 77 K and 60 bar. Its CO2 and CH4 adsorption capacities at 298 K are 77% at 55 bar and 17% at 60 bar, resp. Of particular note is the O2 adsorption capacity of SNU-50' (118% at 77 K and 0.2 atm), which is the highest reported so far for any MOF. By metal-ion exchange of SNU-51 with CuII, [Cu2(bdcppi)(DMF)3]·7DMF·5H2On (SNU-51-CuDMF) with a PtS-type net was prepd., which could not be synthesized by a direct solvothermal reaction.

        4c
        Two-Dimensional Coordination Polymer with a Non-interpenetrated (4,4) Net Showing Anion Exchange and Structural Transformation in Single-Crystal-to-Single-Crystal Fashion
        Aijaz, Arshad; Lama, Prem; Bharadwaj, Parimal K.
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2010), 49 (13), 5883-5889CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        A new non-interpenetrated two-dimensional (2D) rectangular-grid coordination polymer, {[Co(L)2(H2O)2](BF4)2·4DMF}n (1), was synthesized using a new rod-like ligand, 3,5-bis(4-imidazol-1-ylphenyl)-[1,2,4]triazol-4-ylamine (L). Weakly H-bonded BF4- anions present within the voids can be exchanged by ClO4- and NO3- anions to generate {[Co(L)2(H2O)2](ClO4)2·2DMF·2H2O}n (2) and {[Co(L)2(H2O)2](NO3)2·2DMF·2H2O}n (3) in single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SC-SC) manner. In the case of exchange by Cl- ion, the crystallinity is not maintained as proven by IR spectroscopy, PXRD, and elemental anal. 3 Shows an interesting structural transformation (2-dimensional → 1D) with bond rupture/formation giving a new coordination polymer, {[Co(L)2(H2O)2](NO3)2·2DMF·H2O}n, (5), again in SC-SC fashion.

        A series of isostructural mesoporous metal-organic frameworks obtained by ion-exchange induced single-crystal to single-crystal transformation
        Yao, Qingxia; Sun, Junliang; Li, Kuo; Su, Jie; Peskov, Maxim V.; Zou, Xiaodong
        Dalton Transactions (2012), 41 (14), 3953-3955CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)

The transition metal ions in the paddle-wheel metal clusters could be exchanged by other transition metal ions via a direct single-crystal to single-crystal (SCSC) transformation. This post-synthesis route can be used for synthesis of isomorphous metal-org. frameworks that cannot be obtained by direct synthesis.

        5b
        A Simple Method To Determine the R or S Configuration of Molecules with an Axis of Chirality
        Wang, Cunde; Wu, Weiming
        Journal of Chemical Education (2011), 88 (3), 299-301CODEN: JCEDA8; ISSN:0021-9584. (American Chemical Society and Division of Chemical Education, Inc.)
        A simple method for the R or S designation of mols. with an axis of chirality is described. The method involves projection of the substituents along the chiral axis, utilizes the Cahn-Ingold-Prelog sequence rules in assigning priority to the substituents, is easy to use, and has broad applicability.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXhsFGktbbL&md5=55be200ffcea9807678ab6ad15ee2680
